quizzes.title: History Quiz: Santa Claus and Country
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, network, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This celebrity, who considered suntan a symbol denoting a life of privilege and leisure, made sunbathing fashionalble in the 1920s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coco Chanel

questions.question: Although many people consider Santa Claus and Father Christmas to be interchangeable, the characters have different origins and are not completely identical. The American version of Santa Claus says that he lives on the North Pole, while Father Christmas is believed to reside in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finland

questions.question: Saint-Tropez, France has been referred to as the playground to jetsetters, fashion models, and millionaires. What former fashion model and actress made the resort world-famous in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brigitte Bardot

questions.question: What happens to the eccentric shopping network executive, played by Whoopi Goldberg, in the 2001 TV special Call Me Claus?

options.text: She is kidnapped by Santa Claus elves.
She meets the ghost of Santa Claus who was killed by her boss.
She is chosen to become the next Santa Claus.
She founds out that her boss is the real Santa Claus.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She is chosen to become the next Santa Claus.

questions.question: In the comic strip Bloom County, Santa Claus tells the story of how his elves went on strike and were fired by this US President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: What Christmas song popularized the legend according to which Santa Claus categorizes children as naughty or nice?

options.text: Santa Claus Is Coming to Town
I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santa Claus Is Coming to Town

questions.question: What traditional gift-bringer is NOT correctly matched with the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Svatý Mikuláš - Russia

questions.question: In his work History of New York (1809), this author Americanized Sinterklaas into Santa Claus and depicted him as a thick-bellied Dutch sailor with a pipe in a green winter coat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington Irving

questions.question: In many Christian countries the birth of this saint is celebrated on 24 June (Midsummer).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John the Baptist

questions.question: Which of these winter holiday gift-bringers is NOT a kid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weihnachtsmann

questions.question: Which alcoholic beverage is one of the main ingredients in the Sea Breeze cocktail?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vodka

questions.question: Who originally recorded the 1966 song Summer in the City, which was later covered by B. B. King and Joe Cocker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lovin Spoonful

questions.question: The Flying Santa is a tradition that dates back to to Christmas Day of 1929. What does it involve?

options.text: an air show featuring Santa Claus
dropping gifts from planes or helicopters
a circus act featuring Santa Claus

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dropping gifts from planes or helicopters

questions.question: Who created the modern image of the red-suited bearded, plump Santa Claus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Nast

questions.question: Summertime, which has become a popular jazz standard, was written by George Gershwin for this opera.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Porgy and Bess

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Minnesota and Minneapolis
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This American-born author, who became a British subject in 1915 wrote, Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry James

questions.question: In what year was the Minnesota Vikings football team established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1960

questions.question: Which popular island destination is not correctly matched with the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bora Bora - The Dominican Republic

questions.question: What actress wore the iconic white bikini in the 1962 James Bond film, Dr. No?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ursula Andress

questions.question: The Mall of America, one of the largest entertainment and retail complexes in the U.S., opened in 1992 on the site of the old Met Stadium. Which suburb of Minneapolis is it located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bloomington

questions.question: At the time of European contact, the Minnesota region was home to these two large tribal groups.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ojibwe and Dakota

questions.question: A famous mythical logger,  Paul Bunyan, has a famous mythical ox as a sidekick. Whats the name of the ox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe

questions.question: In the late 1880s and 1890s, two brothers, Dr. William and Dr. Charles Mayo, joined forces with an order of Catholic nuns to form one of the worlds best-known medical establishments. What town is it located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rochester

questions.question: Which of the following is the largest ethnic group to immigrate to Minnesota?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germans

questions.question: The headwaters of the Mississippi River originate in Minnesota.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the correct title of Lee Hazlewoods song, which describes a man who awakens to find that his silver spurs a dollar and a dime had been stolen by a mysterious woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Summer Wine

questions.question: This famous writer was born in St. Paul, MN in the month of September, but his family moved around a lot and he once lived on Summit Avenue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: F. Scott Fitzgerald

questions.question: The famous cartoonist Charles Schulz, who was born in Minneapolis in 1922, developed a nationwide cartoon strip called Peanuts. What was the name of the dog in the cartoon strip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snoopy

questions.question: Who was the first US President to be named Man (or Person) of the Year by Time magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

questions.question: What major U.S. interstate highway runs north and south through Minnesota?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I-35

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Time and Year
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, magazine, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What object was chosen as Person of the Year by Time magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The computer

questions.question: Why did David Ho win Time magazines Person of the Year Award in 1996?

options.text: for his work in bringing peace between Taiwan and China
for his research into finding an AIDS/HIV vaccine
for his work on behalf of the refugees of Darfur
for his work in bringing peace to the former Yugoslavia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: for his research into finding an AIDS/HIV vaccine

questions.question: They were the first couple to win Time magazines Man of the Year award?

options.text: King George VIII and Wallis Simpson

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chiang Kai-shek and  Soong May-Ling

questions.question: How many times  did President  Harry S Truman win Time magazines Man of the Year award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: Bono was a recipient of the Time magazines Person of the Year award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In December 1949 this man was chosen Man of the Half-Century by Time magazine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: Who was the first monarch chosen as Man of the Year by Time magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haile Selassie

questions.question: The first abstract choice for Man of the Year was made by Time magazine in 1950. To whom was the  award given?

options.text: The Members of the United Nations

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The American Fighting Man

questions.question: In 1998, Time magazine used an Internet poll to help them select Man of the Year. They rejected the person selected by this pole. Who was that person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mick Foley

questions.question: Find the one who was never named Man (or Person) of the Year by Time magazine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mother Teresa

questions.question: Who was the first Pope named Man of the Year by Time magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pope John XXIII

questions.question: In December 1999, Time magazine announced its Person of the Century. Who was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: He was the first winner of Times Person of the Year title to have a black belt in karate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vladimir Putin

questions.question: Linus Pauling won two Nobel Prizes. Was he ever named Man (or Person) of the year by Time magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Time magazines 2006 choice for Person of the Year caused a great stir and criticisms. Who won in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Year and Memorial Day
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, world, martin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: No Man of the Year award was given by Time magazine in 1966.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year was Decoration Day renamed to Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1882

questions.question: Which flower was adopted in 1922 as an official Memorial Day symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: red poppy

questions.question: Which Congressman and later, US President, was the speaker at the first formal observance of Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James A. Garfield

questions.question: Who composed Taps, a famous musical piece played in the US military on Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Daniel Butterfield

questions.question: Which was the first US state to recognize Memorial Day as an official holiday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: The Tomb of the Unknowns in Arlington National Cemetery, United States, is guarded by members of which military unit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3rd US Infantry

questions.question: When did  Dr. Martin L. King, Jr. win Time magazines Man of the Year award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1963

questions.question: Time magazines 1993 Man of the Yearaward was given to four people. What were they referred to as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peacemakers

questions.question: Tennis player Billie Jean King is among the people named Man of the Year by Time magazine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Indianapolis 500 is an automobile race held annually over Memorial Day weekend. What driver won the first edition of the race in 1911?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Harroun

questions.question: Which city/village is the official birthplace of Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waterloo, New York

questions.question: The founder and President of eBay won Time magazines Person of the Year award in 1999.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following was never named Man (or Person) of the Year by Time magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: The Uniform Holidays Bill according to which Memorial Day is celebrated on the last Monday of May, was passed in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1971

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Fargo and Memorial Day
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, crossroads, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The National Moment of Remembrance, a moment of silence at 3pm on every Memorial Day, was initiated by which US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Clinton

questions.question: What bugler first sounded the musical piece Tapson Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oliver W. Norton

questions.question: Which was the first organization of veterans to distribute the official Memorial Day flower?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Veterans of Foreign Wars

questions.question: Arlington National Cemetery, in Virginia is a military cemetery established during which war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Civil War

questions.question: Which US President presided over the funeral of the Vietnam Unknown, held at Arlington National Cemetery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: In what year was the city of Fargo founded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1871

questions.question: Womens Memorial is a site honoring all military women - past, present and future.  Which cemetery is it located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arlington National Cemetery

questions.question: What is the motto of the city of Fargo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gateway to the West

questions.question: Which of the following rituals is not part of Memorial Day observance?

options.text: flying the US flag at half-staff until noon
the Presidents speech at Arlington National Cemetery
changing guards at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: changing guards at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier

questions.question: Name the sculptor who created the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Hudson Jones

questions.question: What is the duration of the National Moment of Remembrance on Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: one minute

questions.question: Fargo is the crossroads of these two major interstate highway systems.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I-29 and I-94

questions.question: Is it true that the Fargo Theatre is a restored Gothic building?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Which of these statements best describes the United States Navy Memorial?

options.text: a 100-foot diameter granite map of the world

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a 100-foot diameter granite map of the world

questions.question: Which statement about Memorial Day is true?

options.text: Memorial Day and Veterans Day coincide
It commemorates the contributions of those who served in the US military
Memorial Day is more recently established than Veterans Day
It commemorates US men and women who died in military service to their country

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It commemorates US men and women who died in military service to their country

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fargo and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, catskill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Of the 46 peaks over 3800 in New York State, how many have a paved road going to, or near the summit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: To what nation do the Faroe Islands belong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmark

questions.question: The city of Fargo is home to an alternative high school named Woodrow Wilson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which one of these is not a sister city of Fargo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aberdeen, Scotland

questions.question: Fargo is situated on the banks of this river.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red River

questions.question: There are 51 countries in Africa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: All orange juice in the Republic of Ireland is imported.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The museum honoring this professional baseball player is located in the West Acres Shopping Mall in Fargo, ND.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Maris

questions.question: In what country is Lake Nyos located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cameroon

questions.question: What did early settlers often called the Fargo area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Garden of Eden

questions.question: Where is most of the movie Fargo set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Minnesota

questions.question: The Appalachian Trail, that runs from Georgia to Maine, crosses the Hudson River at what point?

options.text: The Patroon Island Bridge at Albany
The Tappan Zee Bridge in Westchester County
The Bear Mountain Bridge below West Point

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bear Mountain Bridge below West Point

questions.question: Russia has the longest coastline in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Iquitos, a major port city on the Amazon River, is located east of the Andes in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peru

questions.question: The section of the Catskill Mountains famous for its Jewish resorts populated by comics like Rodney Dangerfield, Sid Caesar, Mel Brooks, Woody Allen, and dozens more was known as The ________ Belt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Borscht
